data.author: P. J. Reed
data.message:
Refactor GPSFix generation (ROS2) (#73)

Previously, GPSFix messages were generated by synchronizing GPGGA and
GPRMC logs, optionally filling in a few fields from BESTPOS logs when
available.

This will instead produce more accurate GPSFix message with more
fields by instead basing them on BESTPOS logs and synchronizing them
with BESTVEL and PSRDOP2 logs when possible.

Distribution Statement A; OPSEC #2893

Signed-off-by: P. J. Reed <preed@swri.org>

data.author: P. J. Reed
data.message: Update CHANGELOGs

data.author: P. J. Reed
data.message:
Handle GPGSV log with 0 satellites correctly (#77)

If a GPGSV log has 0 satellites, it still has enough empty fields in it for 1 satellite. The size of the message was being calculated incorrectly and ended up throwing an error.

data.author: P. J. Reed
data.message:
Fill out error measurements in GPSFix messages (#71)

Although the comments claimed that error measurements in GPSFix
messages were being filled in from BESTPOS logs, that was not actually
the case.

Fixes #35 for real.

Distribution Statement A; OPSEC #2893

Signed-off-by: P. J. Reed <preed@swri.org>

data.author: P. J. Reed
data.message:
Fix covariance in GPSFix messages (#69)

The covariances in GPSFix messages were not being filled in
due to timestamps in GPGGA messages not being parsed properly.

Fixes #35

data.author: P. J. Reed
data.message:
Use GPGGA quality to set GPSFix status (#55)

This adds enums to the Gpgga message to represent all of the different
possible qualities, and it will also use the quality of GPGGA logs in
order to set the status of the GPSFix message.  It also adds a unit
test to verify that GPGGA logs are being parsed properly.

data.message:
Fix ascii header message id in novatel_gps.cpp (#50)

In the recent PRs to add BESTXYZ, HEADING2, and DUALANTENNAHEADING messages the ASCII message id was missing the "A" on the end. This PR corrects that mistake so ASCII parsing with real hardware should work for those message types now.

data.message:
Fix parsing of gprmc messages for OEM4 models (#22)

* Fix parsing of gprmc messages for OEM4 models

With OEM4 family GPRMC has only 12 fields (against 13 of OEM6 Family)

* Tweak comment to mention OEM7

data.author: Ellon Paiva Mendes
data.message:
Finish serial commands with [CR][LF] (Carriage-Return Line-Feed) (#21)

With OEM4 models, [CR][LF] (\r\n) is the sequence used to mark the end
of command. Without this commands cannot be properly sent through
serial port.

data.author: Joshua Whitley
data.message:
Adds configuration parameter span_frame_to_ros_frame. (#20)

This configuration parameter will apply a VEHICLEBODYROTATION command
which rotates the Novatel SPAN frame 90 degrees counter-clockwise
about the Z axis and an APPLYVEHICLEBODYROTATION command to make
that rotation apply to the IMU and INS outputs. This converts the
Novatel SPAN frame (right-hand rule with Y forward) to a ROS frame
(right-hand rule with X forward).

data.author: Joshua Whitley
data.message:
Adds additional IMUs defined in the OEM7 firmware. (#17)

This helps add support for the PowerPak7 series.

data.author: Matthew
data.message:
Enable the driver to determine IMU sample rate from the IMU type (#9)

* Enable the driver to determine IMU sample rate from the IMU type. Change from defaulting to 200 Hz IMU sample rate to autodetection.

Rename novatel_msgs to novatel_gps_msgs

The open source NovAtel SPAN driver has a package named "novatel_msgs",
so our conflicts with it.  This renames it to "novatel_gps_msgs" in
order to prevent that conflict.

data.author: P. J. Reed
data.message:
Add novatel_msgs as a dep to novatel_oem628

novatel_msgs was not being listed as a catkin dependency in
novatel_oem628's CMakeLists.txt, which meant that catkin
could try to build novatel_oem628 first and cause the build
to fail.

data.message:
Add gpgsv support to novatel driver nodelet.

When parameter ~publish_gpgsv_messages is true, the receiver is
configured to log gpgsv messages at 1.0 Hz and they are published
on `gpgsv` as novatel_msgs/Gpgsv messages.

Add a parameter `~publish_novatel_velocity` to the driver. When this
parameter is set to `true`, publish Novatel BESTVELA messages as
`NovatelVelocity` on the `velocity` topic at 20 Hz.

class.

data.author: Edward Venator
data.message:
Add support for GPGSA messages.

- Add support for GPGSA to the parser
- Add support for choosing message configuration in the Novatal GPS driver
- Add support for GPGSA to the Novatel GPS driver
- Add a parameter publish_gpgsa to the ROS driver that enables publishing
  GPGSA messages at 1 Hz

data.author: Edward Venator
data.message:
Add support to configure the Novatel GPS driver for any message type and frequency.

Add a second Configure() method that accepts a map of (message_name->period) where
message_name is a string name of a Novatel message type and period is a double
number of seconds between messages.

data.author: Marc Alban
data.message:
Merge branch '4-remove-serial-device-name-check' into 'master'

Remove explicit serial device name check

This check used to be done to determine whether the input device was a serial
device or ethernet connection, but it's no longer necessary, and it prevents
the node from working right with udev-aliased node names.

I also reorganized some variables that were being initialized out of order.

Fixes #4

@malban @evenator @jgassaway

See merge request !6

data.author: P. J. Reed
data.message:
Remove explicit serial device name check

This check used to be done to determine whether the input device was a serial
device or ethernet connection, but it's no longer necessary, and it prevents
the node from working right with udev-aliased node names.

I also reorganized some variables that were being initialized out of order.

Fixes #4

data.author: Jason Gassaway
data.message:
Merge branch 'sync-fix' into 'master'

fixes issue caused by previous commit - no gps fix msgs being published

previous commit caused no gps fix msgs to be published because msg buffers
were small, and position msg arrived > 1 sec later than gpgga and gprmc msgs
such that msgs were never synced. Added parameters to specify time sync
tolerances and to optionally not wait for position msg. Position msg is not
critical, it is only used to set position_covariance matrix.

See merge request !3

data.author: Neal Seegmiller
data.message:
fixes issue caused by previous commit - no gps fix msgs being published

previous commit caused no gps fix msgs to be published because msg buffers
were small, and position msg arrived > 1 sec later than gpgga and gprmc msgs
such that msgs were never synced. Added parameters to specify time sync
tolerances and to optionally not wait for position msg. Position msg is not
critical, it is only used to set position_covariance matrix.

Fix NMEA/novatel message synchronization issues

- Fix logic bug in synchronization loop.

data.author: Elliot Johnson
data.message:
Add parameter to set GPS message frame_id.

This commit adds a string parameter named 'frame_id' that will be
copied into the header of every gps message.  This is intended to
correspond to the GPS antenna coordinate frame so that other nodes can
determine where the measurement was taken.  The frame_id defaults to
empty to be compatible with previous behavior.
